sub_topic: Finding the velocity and acceleration of an object using calculus
message_1: A car accelerates from rest at a rate of 5 meters per second squared. Find the velocity of the car after 8 seconds.
message_2:
To find the velocity of the car after 8 seconds, we can use the formula:

v = u + at

where:
v = final velocity
u = initial velocity (0 m/s since the car is at rest)
a = acceleration (5 m/s²)
t = time (8 seconds)

v = 0 + (5 × 8)

v = 0 + 40

v = 40 m/s

The velocity of the car after 8 seconds is 40 meters per second.
